title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 142.5 - Applications for geographic area pay differentials not favorably considered
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 142.5 - Applications for geographic area pay differentials not favorably considered

State Regulations

An application filed with the Director of Classification and

Compensation shall not receive favorable consideration by him under the
provisions of subdivision 5 of section
130
of the

Civil Service Law in any case in which the application is based essentially
upon: (a) a comparison of the State
salary for an occupation with salaries being paid for the similar occupation by
private industry or other nonstate employers throughout the State, without
reference to a particular geographic area; (b) a comparison of the State salary for an
occupation with salaries being paid for the same or a similar occupation by
private industry or other nonstate employers outside the State; (c) a comparison of salaries being paid for
an occupation by private or other nonstate employers in one geographic area of
the State without reference to the salaries being paid for the same or a
similar occupation by private or other nonstate employers generally in the

State; or
(d) other matters or
considerations provided for under sections
120
and
121
of the

Civil Service Law or which are otherwise reviewable pursuant to law or any
rules or regulations having the force and effect of law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
142.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
